title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: The New Package Wizard shows a confusing message when the package name field is empty.
OB: When trying to create a new package in the New Package Wizard, if the package name field is empty, a message appears at the top of the wizard saying 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'.
EB: When trying to create a new package in the New Package Wizard, if the package name field is empty, the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should not appear, as there is no package name entered yet. Instead, the message field should remain empty.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Create a new Java project.
2. Select the project.
3. Open the New Package Wizard.
